<section class="my-5">

### Stacked area chart

<div class="row">

<!-- First column for large screen --> 
<div class="col-lg-6">

```{r area_stacked_code, echo=TRUE, eval=FALSE}
# Loading required packages
library(unhcrthemes)
library(tidyverse)
library(scales)
library(lubridate)

# Loading data
df <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/GDS-ODSSS/unhcr-dataviz-platform/master/data/change_over_time/area_stacked.csv") |> mutate(months = lubridate::my(paste(months, "2022")))

# Plot
ggplot(df) +
  geom_area(aes(x = months, y = funding_million, fill = funding_type)) +
  scale_fill_unhcr_d(palette = "pal_unhcr") +
  labs(title = "Evolution of funding in West Africa region | 2020",
       y = "USD millions",
       caption = "Source: UNHCR Refugee Data Finder\n© UNHCR, The UN Refugee Agency") +
  scale_x_date(date_labels = "%b", breaks = pretty_breaks(n = 12)) +
  scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(c(0, 0.1))) +
  theme_unhcr(grid = "Y", axis = "x", axis_title = "y")
```

</div>
<!-- End First column --->

<!-- Second column for large screen -->

```{r r_area_stacked_chart, echo=FALSE, out.width="100%", fig.height=5.8}

ggplot(df) +
  geom_area(aes(x = months, y = funding_million, fill = funding_type)) +
  scale_fill_unhcr_d(palette = "pal_unhcr") +
  labs(title = "Evolution of funding in West Africa region | 2020",
       y = "USD millions",
       caption = "Source: UNHCR Refugee Data Finder\n© UNHCR, The UN Refugee Agency") +
  scale_x_date(date_labels = "%b", breaks = pretty_breaks(n = 12)) +
  scale_y_continuous(expand = expansion(c(0, 0.1))) +
  theme_unhcr(font_size = 13, grid = "Y", axis = "x", axis_title = "y")
```
